tit.e: Gakusei (educational system, the Education System Order)
Gakusei (educational system, the Education System Order)
Gakusei (educational system, the Education System Order)

sen.j: 学制（がくせい）
sen.e: Gakusei
Gakusei
Gakusei

sen.j: 広義の学制とは、学校制度一般のこと。
sen.e: Gakusei (educational system) in a broad sense is school systems in general.
Gakusei (educational system) in a broad sense is school systems in general.
Gakusei (educational system) in a broad sense is school systems in general.

sen.j: 学校制度の項目を参照のこと。
sen.e: It is described under the heading of "school systems."
It is described under the heading of "school systems."
It is described under the heading of "school systems."

sen.j: 狭義の学制（明治5年太政官布告第214号）とは、1872年（明治5年）に公布された教育法令のこと。
sen.e: Gakusei (the Education System Order: the Proclamation of the Grand Council of the State No. 214, 1872) in a narrow sense is the laws and regulations pertaining to education promulgated in 1872.
Gakusei (the Education System Order: the Proclamation of the Grand Council of the State No. 214, 1872) in a narrow sense is the laws and regulations pertaining to education promulgated in 1872.
Gakusei (the Education System Order: the Proclamation of the Grand Council of the State No. 214, 1872) in a narrow sense is the laws and regulations pertaining to education promulgated in 1872.

sen.j: 本項目で詳述。
sen.e: It is to be explained in detail under this heading.
It is to be explained in detail under this heading.
It is to be explained in detail under this heading.

sen.j: 学制（がくせい、明治5年太政官布告第214号）は、1872年（明治5年）8月3日に公布された、日本にて最初に学校制度を定めた教育法令。
sen.e: Gakusei (the Education System Order: the Proclamation of the Grand Council of the State No. 214, 1872) is the laws and regulations pertaining to education promulgated on August 3, 1872, which first established the school system in Japan.

Gakusei (the Education System Order: the Proclamation of the Grand Council of the State No. 214, 1872) is the laws and regulations pertaining to education promulgated on August 3, 1872, which first established the school system in Japan.

Gakusei (the Education System Order: the Proclamation of the Grand Council of the State No. 214, 1872) is the laws and regulations pertaining to education promulgated on August 3, 1872, which first established the school system in Japan.

sen.j: 教育令（明治12年太政官布告第40号）の公布により、1879年（明治12年）に廃止された。
sen.e: It was repealed in 1879 by the promulgation of Kyoikurei (the 1879 Education Order: the Proclamation of the Grand Council of the State No. 40, 1879).
It was repealed in 1879 by the promulgation of Kyoikurei (the 1879 Education Order: the Proclamation of the Grand Council of the State No. 40, 1879).
It was repealed in 1879 by the promulgation of Kyoikurei (the 1879 Education Order: the Proclamation of the Grand Council of the State No. 40, 1879).

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 「学制」はフランスの学制にならって学区制をとっている。
sen.e: Gakusei' followed French educational system to adopt the school district system.
sen.cmt: 文頭の「'」がエクセルでは表示されません。
sen.e: Gakusei' followed French educational system to adopt the school district system.
Gakusei' followed French educational system to adopt the school district system.

sen.j: 第三章で全国を8の大学区に分け8大学校の、1大学区を32中学区にわけ256中学校の、1中学区を210小学区にわけ53760小学校を置くことを定めた。
sen.e: Chapter 3 provided that the country be divided into 8 university districts: 8 universities in all, each of which be divided into 32 middle school districts: 256 middle schools in all, and each of which be divided into 210 elementary school districts: 53,760 elementary schools in all.

Chapter 3 provided that the country be divided into 8 university districts: 8 universities in all, each of which be divided into 32 middle school districts: 256 middle schools in all, and each of which be divided into 210 elementary school districts: 53,760 elementary schools in all.

Chapter 3 provided that the country be divided into 8 university districts: 8 universities in all, each of which be divided into 32 middle school districts: 256 middle schools in all, and each of which be divided into 210 elementary school districts: 53,760 elementary schools in all.

sen.j: 翌年に改正され、大学区は7大学区に改められて実施された。
sen.e: The order was amended the following year with change of the number of university districts to 7 for the actual enforcement.
The order was amended the following year with change of the number of university districts to 7 for the actual enforcement.
The order was amended the following year with change of the number of university districts to 7 for the actual enforcement.

sen.j: 大学南校、開成所、広運館がそれぞれ中学となり、それぞれ第一大学区、第四大学区、第六大学区に属され、大学東校、大阪医学校、長崎医学校が各大学区の医学校となった。
sen.e: Daigaku Nanko (the Southern College of the University, a predecessor of the University of Tokyo), Kaiseijo and Kounkan became middle schools which belonged to the 1st university district, the 4th university district and the 6th university district respectively, and Daigaku Toko (the Eastern College of the University), Osaka Igakko (Osaka Medical School) and Nagasaki Igakko (Nagasaki Medical School) became the medical schools of each university district.
sen.cmt: 原文の「開成所」は大阪開成所を指すと思われますが（「開成所」のみでは大学南校の前身と混同され、文に矛盾が生じます）原文に従い単に"Kaiseijo"としました。
sen.e: Daigaku Nanko (the Southern College of the University, a predecessor of the University of Tokyo), Kaiseijo and Kounkan became middle schools which belonged to the 1st university district, the 4th university district and the 6th university district respectively, and Daigaku Toko (the Eastern College of the University), Osaka Igakko (Osaka Medical School) and Nagasaki Igakko (Nagasaki Medical School) became the medical schools of each university district.

Daigaku Nanko (the Southern College of the University, a predecessor of the University of Tokyo), Kaiseijo and Kounkan became middle schools which belonged to the 1st university district, the 4th university district and the 6th university district respectively, and Daigaku Toko (the Eastern College of the University), Osaka Igakko (Osaka Medical School) and Nagasaki Igakko (Nagasaki Medical School) became the medical schools of each university district.

sen.j: 8の大学とは北海道大学、東北大学、東京大学、名古屋大学、大阪大学、京都大学、広島大学、九州大学である
sen.e: 8 universities were Hokkaido University, Tohoku University, The University of Tokyo, Nagoya University, Osaka University, Kyoto University, Hiroshima University and Kyusyu University.
The 8 universities were Hokkaido University, Tohoku University, The University of Tokyo, Nagoya University, Osaka University, Kyoto University, Hiroshima University and Kyusyu University.
sen.cmt: 8 universitiesに定冠詞をつけました。
sen.e: The 8 universities were Hokkaido University, Tohoku University, The University of Tokyo, Nagoya University, Osaka University, Kyoto University, Hiroshima University and Kyusyu University.

sen.j: 翌年大学区が改定され七大学区とし、中学区は239区、小学区は42451区に改められた。
sen.e: The following year the university districts were revised to set up 7 university districts, 239 middle school districts and 42,451 elementary school districts.
The following year the university districts were revised to set up 7 university districts, 239 middle school districts and 42,451 elementary school districts.
The following year the university districts were revised to set up 7 university districts, 239 middle school districts and 42,451 elementary school districts.

sen.j: これに伴い石川県の大学本部は廃止され第三大学区と第四大学区が統合し、以下学区の番号が繰り上がり、青森県の大学本部が宮城県に移された。
sen.e: Following this revision, the main office of universities in Ishikawa Prefecture was closed; the 3rd university district and the 4th university district were integrated so that the following numbers of school districts moved up, and the main office of universities in Aomori Prefecture moved to Miyagi Prefecture.

sen.j: 学校種
sen.e: Kinds of schools
Kinds of schools
Kinds of schools

sen.j: 第20章からは小学校について定めており、尋常小学、女児小学、村落小学、貧人小学（仁恵学校）、小学私塾、幼稚小学、廃人学校について規定している。
sen.e: From Chapter 20 the order had provisions for elementary schools, such as Jinjo shogaku (ordinary elementary schools), elementary schools for girls, village elementary schools, elementary schools for the poor (also called Jinkei Gakko), private elementary schools, elementary schools for infants, and schools for disabled children.

From Chapter 20 there were provisions for elementary schools, such as Jinjo shogaku (ordinary elementary schools), elementary schools for girls, village elementary schools, elementary schools for the poor (also called Jinkei Gakko), private elementary schools, elementary schools for infants, and schools for disabled children.
sen.cmt: the order hadは３セルしたの表現にそろえ、there wereとしました。
sen.e: From Chapter 20 there were provisions for elementary schools, such as Jinjo shogaku (ordinary elementary schools), elementary schools for girls, village elementary schools, elementary schools for the poor (also called Jinkei Gakko), private elementary schools, elementary schools for infants, and schools for disabled children.

sen.j: 尋常小学校は下等4年、上等4年に分けられた。
sen.e: Ordinary elementary schools were divided into lower division of four years and upper division of four years.
Ordinary elementary schools were divided into lower division of four years and upper division of four years.
Ordinary elementary schools were divided into lower division of four years and upper division of four years.

sen.j: 但し、幼稚小学は実現に至らなかった。
sen.e: However, elementary schools for infants were not realized.
However, elementary schools for infants were not realized.
However, elementary schools for infants were not realized.

sen.j: 中学校は第29章から定められており、やはり上下2等（各3年）に分けられている。
sen.e: From Chapter 29 there were provisions for middle schools which were also divided into two levels: upper and lower divisions (3 years for each).
From Chapter 29 there were provisions for middle schools which were also divided into two levels: upper and lower divisions (3 years for each).
From Chapter 29 there were provisions for middle schools which were also divided into two levels: upper and lower divisions (3 years for each).

sen.j: また中学に相当するものとして変則中学、家塾、中学私塾が定められている。
sen.e: The order also set up irregular middle schools, Kajuku (government-backed school operated by a scholar out of his home) and private middle schools as the equivalents of middle schools.
The order also set up irregular middle schools, Kajuku (government-backed school operated by a scholar out of his home) and private middle schools as the equivalents of middle schools.
The order also set up irregular middle schools, Kajuku (government-backed school operated by a scholar out of his home) and private middle schools as the equivalents of middle schools.

sen.j: 第33章からは夜間の職業学校として諸民学校を定めている。
sen.e: From Chapter 33 there were provisions for Shomin Gakko: evening vocational schools.
From Chapter 33 there were provisions for Shomin Gakko(evening vocational schools).
From Chapter 33 there were provisions for Shomin Gakko(evening vocational schools).

sen.j: 諸民学校には農業学校、通弁学校、商業学校、工業学校が定められた。
sen.e: It was provided that Shomin Gakko should include agricultural schools, interpretational schools, commercial schools and technical schools.
It was provided that Shomin Gakko should include agricultural schools, interpretational schools, commercial schools and technical schools.
It was provided that Shomin Gakko should include agricultural schools, interpretational schools, commercial schools and technical schools.

sen.j: 大学は「高尚の諸学を教る専門科の学校」で理学、文学、法学、医学を置くことが定められた。
sen.e: It was provided that universities as 'specialized schools for offering the highest level of education in various studies' have the departments of science, literature, law and medicine.
It was provided that universities as 'specialized schools for offering the highest level of education in various studies' have the departments of science, literature, law and medicine.
It was provided that universities as 'specialized schools for offering the highest level of education in various studies' have the departments of science, literature, law and medicine.

sen.j: だが国民の負担が重いなど実情にあわず、1879年（明治12年）の教育令によって廃止された。
sen.e: However, because it was inappropriate to the real situation for the heavy imposition on people and so on, the order was repealed and replaced by Kyoikurei in 1879.
However, because it was inappropriate to the real situation for the heavy imposition on people and so on, the order was repealed and replaced by Kyoikurei (the 1879 Education Order) in 1879.
sen.cmt: 教育令の説明を追記しました。
sen.e: However, because it was inappropriate to the real situation for the heavy imposition on people and so on, the order was repealed and replaced by Kyoikurei (the 1879 Education Order) in 1879.

sen.j: 以下は詳しい学制の仕組み（進路）である。
sen.e: Details of Gakusei system (future courses) were as follows.
Details of Gakusei system (future courses) were as follows.
